title: Managing disobedient behaviour
creator_contributor_role: New England Educational Diagnostic Centre, production company
subject_group: Food, Health, Lifestyle, Medicine, Psychology & Safety/Behavior modification
Food, Health, Lifestyle, Medicine, Psychology & Safety/Handicapped children - Education

Food, Health, Lifestyle, Medicine, Psychology & Safety/Developmentally disabled children
description: Episode of Series "Managing difficult behaviours". Module 3.2. Designed to assist the intellectual disability residential care worker to understand what disobedient behaviour is, why it occurs, how to prevent such behaviour, how to deal with disobedience which has become a regular behaviour pattern and how to manage disobedient behaviour crises. Accompanied by 45p. in-service training manual.
related_objects: Series; S01244; Managing difficult behaviours; Active; 1986
